required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Gene Associations and Infertility
clinical_study.official_title: Genes and Gene Polymorphisms Associated With Infertility: Utilization of DNA Characteristics to Better Understand Reproductive Competence

lead_sponsor.agency: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this this study is to use DNA screening strategies to identify genes and localize genomic regions that are differentially expressed in patients with infertility to further understand the genetic basis for reproductive competence.

detailed_description.textblock: Experimental strategies seek to discover small variants in DNA sequences, which are associated with certain infertility parameters. The alleles being analyzed in in vitro fertilization (IVF) population are sought to be associated with functional differences in the expression of the gene product that are then mechanistically linked to infertility.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of oocytes that are fertilized
Number of embryos that are available for transfer on day 3 or day 5
Clinical pregnancy rates (detection of pregnancy hormone bHCG in blood) and delivery rates.

arm_group.description: Male and female patients undergoing infertility treatment

biospec_descr.textblock: whole blood serum, follicular fluid and sperm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients undergoing fertility care
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

facility.name: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

link.description: Reproductive Medicine Associates of New Jersey

reference.citation: Patounakis G, Treff N, Tao X, Lonczak A, Scott RT Jr, Frattarelli JL. The p53 codon 72 single nucleotide polymorphism lacks a significant effect on implantation rate in fresh in vitro fertilization cycles: an analysis of 1,056 patients. Fertil Steril. 2009 Oct;92(4):1290-6. doi: 10.1016/j.fertnstert.2008.07.1783. Epub 2008 Oct 17.
